revised_title: Finite-Time Break-up in Three-Dimensional Unsteady Interacting Boundary Layers
tldr: This article investigates the occurrence of finite-time break-up singularities in three-dimensional unsteady interacting boundary layers, extending previous two-dimensional theory. The study focuses on liquid-layer flow at subcritical Froude numbers and flow over relatively short steep humps, providing computational and theoretical insights into the behavior of these complex interactions in boundary layers.
scientific_discipline: Environmental and Earth Sciences > Fluid Dynamics
